title: Chicken Liver Toasts
introduction: These succulent Chicken Liver Toasts, known as Crostini di Fegato di Pollo in Italian, are a Tuscan delight. Typically served alongside local salumi such as finocchiona, this appetizer combines the rich, hearty flavors of chicken liver with delicate herbs on crunchy toasted Italian bread.
ingredients: 1 medium red onion, sliced and separated into rings
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Trim the chicken livers, cutting away the connecting fibers with a sharp knife. Cut each liver into 2 or 3 pieces. Rinse the livers and pat dry.
Pour the oil into a medium skillet. Add the onion and sage leaves and cook over medium heat until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the chicken livers and cook, mashing the livers with the back of a spoon, until just slightly pink, about 2 minutes. Add the vinegar and salt and pepper to taste.

Place a barbecue grill or broiler rack about 5 inches away from the heat source. Preheat the grill or broiler. Toast the bread on one side until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Turn the bread and toast the other side, about 2 minutes.
Top the bread with the liver mixture. Serve immediately.
